scoring_rule: Each problem: ALL words must be correct. Level: 80% of problems must pass.

problems.prompt:
# Syllable Puzzle

Find 10 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
pa, step, fronting, mem, lulite, neers, en, at, o, age, caries, gi, ing, ra, aas, chain, saw, odessa, tain, ther, tilles, nipo, tron, bards, repli, fa, tion, able, cat, com

## Clues
A. (3 syllables) — bend or turn backward
B. (1 syllables) — An analogous relationship between the vowel sounds in a dialect of a language relative to the language standard or an earlier form of the language.
C. (3 syllables) — Able to be accomplished, achieved, or obtained.
D. (2 syllables) — portable power saw; teeth linked to form an endless chain
E. (3 syllables) — Customers collectively; clientele; business.
F. (3 syllables) — the operator of a railway locomotive
G. (5 syllables) — a recognition of meritorious service
H. (3 syllables) — The husband of one's biological mother after her initial marriage to or relationship with one's biological father.
I. (1 syllables) — an associate degree in arts
J. (1 syllables) — an ornamental caparison for a horse

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

# Syllable Puzzle

Find 11 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank

## Clues
A. (3 syllables) — in a clumsy manner
B. (1 syllables) — cut or make a way through
C. (1 syllables) — tasteless showiness
D. (1 syllables) — the jaw in vertebrates that is hinged to open the mouth
E. (1 syllables) — DOM: deer
F. (1 syllables) — offer in good faith
G. (2 syllables) — make shallow
H. (1 syllables) — ; as in .[masked] (the most known Internet top-level domain).
I. (3 syllables) — DOM: shape
J. (2 syllables) — A communal bathhouse in Islamic countries and communities.
K. (3 syllables) — The act of igniting.

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

# Syllable Puzzle

# Syllable Puzzle

Find 12 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
pen, sciut, ter, mer, pret, ibrahim, op, caf, modal, ser, to, sup, prison, tine, courage, ple, ford, wa, men, heads, try, jim, im, tary, tom, e, fahren, gulch, ing, heit, ham, war, pro, butts, gags, smith

## Clues
A. (2 syllables) — German physicist who invented the mercury thermometer and developed the scale of temperature that bears his name (1686-1736)
B. (2 syllables) — the front part of a guided missile or rocket or torpedo that carries the nuclear or explosive charge or the chemical or biological agents
C. (1 syllables) — a humorous anecdote or remark intended to provoke laughter
D. (4 syllables) — The art and science of vision and eye care.
E. (3 syllables) — A maker of hammers.
F. (4 syllables) — ; added to supply what is wanted.
G. (3 syllables) — Pertaining to the of minerals.
H. (3 syllables) — The art or process of giving a wavy, ornamental appearance to something.
I. (1 syllables) — Of, relating to, or composed in the musical modi by which an octave is divided, associated with emotional moods in Ancient — and in medieval ecclesiastical — music.
J. (1 syllables) — To jimmy (something); to mess up or mess with (something).
K. (3 syllables) — Italian salt-cured ham usually sliced paper thin
L. (2 syllables) — To put in or as if in prison; confine somebody against their will.

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.
